de.esoco.lib.concurrent

Class ThreadMap<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<java.lang.Thread,T>
      • de.esoco.lib.concurrent.ThreadMap<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Map<java.lang.Thread,T>

    public class ThreadMap<T>
extends java.util.AbstractMap<java.lang.Thread,T>
    A special map implementation that associates threads with arbitrary values. It contains several methods that will automatically associate the current thread (queried through Thread.currentThread()) with a value. These methods are put(Object), get(), and remove(). Access to the internal data structures of a thread map instance is synchronized so that it's methods may be invoked from different threads. The values for terminated threads are automatically removed when accessing the map.

    This class is intended for cases where code needs access to the managed Thread objects. If it is only necessary to store a thread-related value it is recommended to use the ThreadLocal class instead.

      • remove

        public T remove()
        Removes the mapping for the current thread from which the method has been invoked.
        Returns:
